abstract.text: An object that provides a list view for displaying content in a macOS Today widget.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

platforms.message: Use WidgetKit instead. Today View extensions have been deprecated.
platforms.name: macOS

inlineContent.text: class provides a list view for displaying content in a Today widget. A list view controller works together with its delegate to display content and support user interaction with the list. To learn about the list view controller delegate methods, see
You store the contents of a widget as an array of objects in the list view controller’s
property. To display the objects, you use a
object, which provides a custom view controller for each object in

. A list view controller also provides properties that make it easy to specify aspects of the list’s appearance and behavior, such as the number of rows to display, the presence of divider lines, and the ability to edit the list.

abstract.text: Extend the reach of your app by creating widgets, watch complications, Live Activities, and controls.
Create and manage widgets for the Today view.
An object that provides a list view for displaying content in a macOS Today widget.
An array of objects to display in the list view.
The list view controller’s delegate or
if the receiver doesn’t have a delegate.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the list is in editing mode.
A Boolean value that indicates whether list displays divider lines between rows.
The minimum number of visible rows to display.
Returns the row represented by the specified content view controller.
A Boolean value that indicates whether an Add (+) button is displayed while the list is in editing mode.
Returns the content view controller associated with the specified row, or a new content view controller if desired.
The interface for handling content display and editing in the list view of a macOS Today widget.
A controller that manages a view, typically loaded from a nib file.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The interface an app extension uses to respond to a request from a host app.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A set of methods that support the mediation of a custom segue.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
